channel.title: BBC Sport | Sport Homepage | UK Edition
channel.description: BBC Sport: breaking news, results, video, audio and analysis on football, cricket, rugby, golf, tennis, motorsport and all the main world sports.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/help/rss/4517815.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: England will recover - Gerrard
item.description: New captain Steven Gerrard says England will be fully prepared for their first World Cup match despite the loss of Rio Ferdinand.

item.title: England on top despite Tamim ton
item.description: Tamim Iqbal hits 108 but Bangladesh are bowled out for 216, 203 runs behind England, on day two of the second Test at Old Trafford.

item.title: Schiavone wins French Open title
item.description: Francesca Schiavone beats Australia's Sam Stosur in the French Open final to become the first Italian woman to win a Grand Slam singles title.

item.title: Workforce powers to Derby victory
item.description: Workforce, trained by Sir Michael Stoute and ridden by Ryan Moore, wins the Derby by seven lengths with a record run at Epsom.

item.title: Springboks beat Wales in thriller
item.description: South Africa secure a narrow 34-31 victory in Cardiff as Wales miss out on only a second win in 104 years against the Springboks.

item.title: Drogba's arm surgery 'successful'
item.description: Didier Drogba undergoes a "successful" operation on his fractured arm, but the Ivory Coast star's World Cup participation remains in doubt.

item.title: Injured Robben a World Cup doubt
item.description: Dutch winger Arjen Robben is a major doubt for the World Cup finals after limping off during his country's 6-1 friendly victory over Hungary.

item.title: Nigeria's Mikel out of World Cup
item.description: Nigeria midfielder John Mikel Obi is ruled out of the World Cup with a knee injury.

item.title: Hiddink 'will not join Liverpool'
item.description: Former Chelsea boss Guus Hiddink is highly unlikely to become the new manager of Liverpool, according to the Dutchman's agent, Cees van Nieuwenhuizen.

item.title: Man City secure Boateng signing
item.description: Manchester City complete the signing of German defender Jerome Boateng from Hamburg.

item.title: Rossi sidelined with broken leg
item.description: Valentino Rossi could be out for up to six months after suffering a compound fracture of his right leg in practice for the Italian MotoGP.

item.title: Nadal ready for Soderling rematch
item.description: Four-time champion Rafael Nadal insists revenge is not on his mind as he prepares to take on his 2009 conqueror Robin Soderling in the French Open final on Sunday.

item.title: Siem closes in on Wales Open win
item.description: Germany's Marcel Siem leads by three shots after day three of the Wales Open at Celtic Manor.

item.title: Memorial Tournament leaderboard
item.description: Latest scores from the Memorial Tournament at Muirfield Village, Ohio, as Tiger Woods defends his title.

item.title: Cawthorn eases to gold in Germany
item.description: Britain's Rachel Cawthorn wins gold in the women's K1 1,000m at the final World Cup event in Germany.
